maml:description.maml:para: Add a new PSWorkItem category

When you setup a new PSWorkItem database, it will define the default categories of Personal, Work, Project, and Other. You may want to add categories. The category must be defined before you can use it. The category will not be added if it already exists unless you use -Force. Or if you need to update a category description you can re-add it with -Force. If the category name needs to be edited, remove the category and re-add it.
Specify the category name
Specify a category comment or description.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the command.
Force overwriting an existing category.
The path to the PSWorkItem SQLite database file. It should end in .db
Shows what would happen if the command runs. The command is not run.
Specify the category name
Prompts you for confirmation before running the command.
Specify a category comment or description.
Force overwriting an existing category.
The path to the PSWorkItem SQLite database file. It should end in .db
Shows what would happen if the command runs. The command is not run.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Add-PSWorkItemCategory -Name Blog -Description "blog management and content" -PassThru
Category Description -------- ----------- Blog blog management and content

maml:description.maml:para: Mark a PSWorkItem as complete.

When you are ready to mark a task as complete, use this command. Complete-PSWorkItem will set the progress to 100, mark the item as completed, copy it to the Arhive table and delete it from the tasks table. There are no commands to modify the task after it has been marked as completed so if you need to update the category, name, or description, do so before completing it.
The PSWorkItem ID. The task will get a new ID in the Archive table.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the command.
The path to the PSWorkItem SQLite database file. It should end in .db
Shows what would happen if the command runs. The command is not run.
Specify the completion date. The default is now.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the command.
The PSWorkItem ID. The task will get a new ID in the Archive table.
The path to the PSWorkItem SQLite database file. It should end in .db
Shows what would happen if the command runs. The command is not run.
Specify the completion date. The default is now.

maml:alert.maml:para: This command has an alias of cwi.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Complete-PSWorkItem -id 9 -PassThru
Database: C:\Users\Jeff\PSWorkItem.db ID Name Description Category Completed -- ---- ----------- -------- --------- 6 Clean database Other 7/30/2022 10:40:48 AM

dev:remarks.maml:para: Mark a PSWorkItem as completed and move it to the Archive table. The PSWorkItem will most likely get a new ID. The item will be deleted from the Tasks table.

maml:description.maml:para: Get a PSWorkItem.

This command will retrieve PSWorkItems from the database using a parameter defined query. The default behavior is to get all PSWorkItems due within the next 10 days. If you are running the command in the PowerShell console or VSCode, the default formatting will highlight overdue tasks in red and tasks due within 3 days in yellow.
Get all open tasks.
The path to the PSWorkItem SQLite database file. It should end in .db.
Get all open tasks by category. There should be tab-completion for this parameter.
The path to the PSWorkItem SQLite database file. It should end in .db.
Get open tasks due in the number of days between 1 and 365.
The path to the PSWorkItem SQLite database file. It should end in .db.
The task ID.
The path to the PSWorkItem SQLite database file. It should end in .db.
The name of the work item. Wilcards are supported.
The path to the PSWorkItem SQLite database file. It should end in .db.
Get all open tasks.
Get all open tasks by category. There should be tab-completion for this parameter.
Get open tasks due in the number of days between 1 and 365.
The task ID.
The name of the work item. Wilcards are supported.
The path to the PSWorkItem SQLite database file. It should end in .db.

maml:alert.maml:para: This command has an alias of gwi.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-PSWorkItem
Database: C:\Users\Jeff\PSWorkItem.db
ID Name Description DueDate Category Pct -- ---- ----------- ------- -------- --- 6 new server prep SQL02 8/3/2022 5:00:00 PM Work 45 7 password report 8/5/2022 12:00:00 PM Work 10 5 revise blog pages essentials and tips 8/7/2022 5:00:00 PM Other 0

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get all items due in the next 10 days.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-PSWorkItem -all
Database: C:\Users\Jeff\PSWorkItem.db
ID Name Description DueDate Category Pct -- ---- ----------- ------- -------- --- 6 new server prep SQL02 8/3/2022 5:00:00 PM Work 45 7 password report 8/5/2022 12:00:00 PM Work 10 5 revise blog pages essentials and tips 8/7/2022 5:00:00 PM Other 0 1 update data 8/28/2022 10:35:02 AM Temp 0 9 Prep vacation 11/1/2022 5:00:00 PM Personal 0 8 Year end backup 12/31/2022 5:00:00 PM Work 0

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get all open tasks.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-PSWorkItem -Category Work
Database: C:\Users\Jeff\PSWorkItem.db
ID Name Description DueDate Category Pct -- ---- ----------- ------- -------- --- 6 new server prep SQL02 8/3/2022 5:00:00 PM Work 45 7 password report 8/5/2022 12:00:00 PM Work 10 8 Year end backup 12/31/2022 5:00:00 PM Work 0

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get tasks from the Work category.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-PSWorkItem -id 9
Database: C:\Users\Jeff\PSWorkItem.db
ID Name Description DueDate Category Pct -- ---- ----------- ------- -------- --- 9 Prep vacation 11/1/2022 5:00:00 PM Personal 0

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get a PSWorkItem by its ID.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 5 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-PSWorkItem -Name p*
Database: C:\Users\Jeff\PSWorkItem.db
ID Name Description DueDate Category Pct -- ---- ----------- ------- -------- --- 7 password report 8/5/2022 12:00:00 PM Work 10 9 Prep vacation 11/1/2022 5:00:00 PM Personal 0

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get PSWorkItems with a name that begins with P.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 6 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-PSWorkItem | Format-Table -View countdown
ID Name Description DueDate TimeRemaining -- ---- ----------- ------- ------------- 6 new server prep SQL02 8/3/2022 5:00:00 PM 4.05:20:31 7 password report 8/5/2022 12:00:00 PM 6.00:20:31 5 revise blog pages essentials and tips 8/7/2022 5:00:00 PM 8.05:20:31

dev:remarks.maml:para: The PSWorkItem has a named table view called Countdown.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 7 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-PSWorkItem | Where Overdue
Database: C:\Users\Jeff\PSWorkItem.db
ID Name Description DueDate Category Pct -- ---- ----------- ------- -------- --- 13 extend car warranty 6/1/2022 4:00:00 PM Personal 0 11 update resume 7/12/2022 12:00:00 PM Work 0 7 password report 7/15/2022 5:00:00 PM Work 10

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get all overdue PSWorkItems.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 8 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-PSWorkItem -all | Sort-Object category | Format-Table -view category
Category: Other
ID Name Description DueDate Pct -- ---- ----------- ------- --- 5 revise blog pages essentials and tips 8/7/2022 5:00:00 PM 0
Category: Personal
ID Name Description DueDate Pct -- ---- ----------- ------- --- 13 extend car warranty 6/1/2022 4:00:00 PM 0 10 car wash 8/2/2022 11:54:31 AM 0 9 Prep vacation 11/1/2022 5:00:00 PM 0
Category: Project
ID Name Description DueDate Pct -- ---- ----------- ------- --- 12 Publish PSWorkItem 8/2/2022 12:05:44 PM 0 ...

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get PSWorkItems sorted by category and display using the Category table view.

Completed PSWorkItems are moved to the Archive table. Using this command to view completed tasks.
Get all open tasks by category. There should be tab-completion for this parameter.
The path to the PSWorkItem SQLite database file. It should end in .db
The task ID. This value will most likely be different than the original ID.
The path to the PSWorkItem SQLite database file. It should end in .db
The name of the work item. Wildcards are supported.
The path to the PSWorkItem SQLite database file. It should end in .db
Get all open tasks by category. There should be tab-completion for this parameter.
The task ID. This value will most likely be different than the original ID.

ID Name Description Category Completed -- ---- ----------- -------- --------- 1 upgrade prep Temp 7/29/2022 10:35:42 AM 2 Order dog food Personal 7/30/2022 10:09:09 AM 3 Update-PSScripting update scripting and toolmaking book Project 7/30/2022 10:13:45 AM 4 car inspection Personal 7/30/2022 10:35:03 AM 6 Clean database Other 7/30/2022 10:40:48 AM 5 weekly report work 8/1/2022 8:30:00 AM

Database: C:\Users\Jeff\PSWorkItem.db
ID Name Description Category Completed -- ---- ----------- -------- --------- 2 Order dog food Personal 7/30/2022 10:09:09 AM 4 car inspection Personal 7/30/2022 10:35:03 AM

maml:description.maml:para: Get defined PSWorkItem categories.
When you create a PSWorkItem, you need to tag it with a category. The category must be defined before you can use it. Get-PSWorkItem category will display information about your categories.
Specify the category name.
The path to the PSWorkItem SQLite database file. It should end in .db
Specify the category name.
The path to the PSWorkItem SQLite database file. It should end in .db

PS C:\> Get-PSWorkItemCategory
Category Description -------- ----------- Work Anything client-oriented Customer Anything client-oriented Other Miscellaneous catch-all Personal Personal or family tasks Project Module or assigned work Business Corporate-related tasks Event Conference, webinar, or other event Testing Sample category for testing Training Anything related to a training event Blog Blog management or content

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------

PS C:\> Get-PSWorkItemCategory blog
Category Description -------- ----------- Blog Blog management or content

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get information about a single category.

maml:description.maml:para: Get raw database table data.

Most of the time you will use commands like Get-PSWorkItem to get data from the PSWorkItem database. Get-PSWorkItemData can be used to query the database directly and skip creating custom objects. This could be a helpful command for troubleshooting or debugging.
Specify the table name. The default is Tasks
The path to the PSWorkItem SQLite database file. It should end in .db
The path to the PSWorkItem SQLite database file. It should end in .db
Specify the table name. The default is Tasks

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-PSWorkItemData | Out-GridView

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get all data from the Tasks table and display using Out-GridView.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-PSWorkItemData Categories
category description rowid -------- ----------- ----- Work 6 Customer 7 Other Miscellaneous catch-all 8 Personal 9 Project Module or assigned work 10 Event Conference, webinar, or other event 12

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get all data from the Categories table.

maml:description.maml:para: Get information about the PSWorkItem database
Use this command to get a summary of the PSWorkItem database file. You can not modify the database file by modifying any properties of the PSWorkItemDatabase object.
The path to the PSWorkItem SQLite database file. It should end in .db
The path to the PSWorkItem SQLite database file. It should end in .db

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-PSWorkItemDatabase
Path: C:\Users\Jeff\PSWorkItem.db [32KB]
Created LastModified Tasks Archived Categories ------- ------------ ----- -------- ---------- 7/29/2022 9:59:59 AM 7/30/2022 11:20:17 AM 6 6 5

dev:remarks.maml:para: The default summary.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-PSWorkItemDatabase | Format-List
Path : C:\Users\Jeff\PSWorkItem.db Created : 7/29/2022 9:59:59 AM LastModified : 7/30/2022 11:20:17 AM Size : 32768 TaskCount : 6 CategoryCount : 5 ArchiveCount : 6 Encoding : UTF-8 PageCount : 8 PageSize : 4096

dev:remarks.maml:para: There are additional properties.

maml:description.maml:para: Get a summary report of PSWorkItems.
Use this simple command to get a report of PSWorkItems by category. The percentages for each category are rounded. The percentage of Overdue items is based on all open work items.
The path to the PSWorkItem SQLite database file. It should end in .db
The path to the PSWorkItem SQLite database file. It should end in .db

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-PSWorkItemReport
Path: C:\Users\Jeff\PSWorkItem.db
Count Category PctTotal ----- -------- -------- 3 Personal 50 1 Other 17 1 Event 17 1 Blog 17 2 Overdue 33

maml:description.maml:para: Create a new PSWorkItem database file.

Before you can define and PSWorkItems or categories, you need to setup the SQLite database file. By default the file will be created using the $PSWorkItem path which points to $HOME\PSWorkItem.db. If you want to use a different location you should change the variable before creating to make it easier to use the commands in this module. Advanced users may want to setup multiple database files in which case, they will need to keep track of paths.
If the file already exists, the command will not complete unless you use the -Force parameter.
The setup will also define the default categories of Work, Personal, Project, and Other.
The path to the PSWorkItem SQLite database file. It should end in .db
Prompts you for confirmation before running the command.
Force overwriting an existing file.
Shows what would happen if the command runs. The command is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the command.
Force overwriting an existing file.
The path to the PSWorkItem SQLite database file. It should end in .db
Shows what would happen if the command runs. The command is not run.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Initialize-PSWorkItemDatabase

dev:remarks.maml:para: Create a new database file.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Initialize-PSWorkItemDatabase -PassThru
Database: C:\Users\jeff\PSWorkItem.db Table:Metadata
ColumnIndex ColumnName ColumnType ----------- ---------- ---------- 0 Author TEXT 1 Created TEXT 2 Computername TEXT 3 Comment TEXT
Database: C:\Users\jeff\PSWorkItem.db Table:tasks
ColumnIndex ColumnName ColumnType ----------- ---------- ---------- 0 taskid text 1 taskcreated text 2 taskmodified text 3 name text 4 description text 5 duedate text 6 category text 7 progress integer 8 completed integer
Database: C:\Users\jeff\PSWorkItem.db Table:archive
ColumnIndex ColumnName ColumnType ----------- ---------- ---------- 0 taskid text 1 taskcreated text 2 taskmodified text 3 name text 4 description text 5 duedate text 6 category text 7 progress integer 8 completed integer
Database: C:\Users\jeff\PSWorkItem.db Table:categories
ColumnIndex ColumnName ColumnType ----------- ---------- ---------- 0 category text 1 description text

dev:remarks.maml:para: The PassThru output shows the new table definitions.

maml:description.maml:para: Create a new PSWorkItem.

Use this command to add a new PSWorkItem to the database. It is assumed you have already defined your task categories. The default is to create a new PSWorkItem with a due date 30 days from now. You can specify any due date or the number of days from now.
The name of the work item.
Select a valid category. The category must be pre-defined. There should be tab-completion for this parameter.
Add a comment or task description.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the command.
When is this task due? The default is 30 days.
The path to the PSWorkItem SQLite database file. It should end in .db.
Shows what would happen if the command runs. The command is not run.
The name of the work item.
Select a valid category. The category must be pre-defined. There should be tab-completion for this parameter.
Add a comment or task description.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the command.
The path to the PSWorkItem SQLite database file. It should end in .db.
Shows what would happen if the command runs. The command is not run.
Specify the number of days before the task is due to be completed. Enter a value between 1 and 365.
Select a valid category. The category must be pre-defined. There should be tab-completion for this parameter.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the command.
Add a comment or task description.
When is this task due? The default is 30 days.
The name of the work item.
The path to the PSWorkItem SQLite database file. It should end in .db.
Shows what would happen if the command runs. The command is not run.
Specify the number of days before the task is due to be completed. Enter a value between 1 and 365.

maml:alert.maml:para: This command has an alias of nwi.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-PSWorkItem -Name "Blog updates" -Description "update pages" -DueDate "8/15/2022 5:00PM" -Category Blog -PassThru

dev:remarks.maml:para: Create a new PSWorkItem with a due date 30 days from now. You should be able to use tab completion for the Category parameter.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-PSWorkItem -Name "Publish PSWorkItem" -DaysDue 3 -Category Project

dev:remarks.maml:para: Create a new PSWorkItem due in 3 days.

maml:description.maml:para: Remove a PSWorkItem.

If you want to delete a PSWorkItem from the database, use Remove-PSWorkItem. You might do this to correct a mistake or to delete a cancelled task. To mark a task as complete and retain an archived copy, use Complete-PSWorkItem.
The work item ID.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the command.
The path to the PSWorkItem SQLite database file. It should end in .db
Shows what would happen if the command runs. The command is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the command.
The work item ID.
The path to the PSWorkItem SQLite database file. It should end in .db
Shows what would happen if the command runs. The command is not run.

maml:alert.maml:para: This command should have an alias of rwi.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Remove-PSWorkItem -ID 10

dev:remarks.maml:para: Remove the PSWorkItem with an ID of 10.

maml:description.maml:para: Remove archive PSWorkItems

Completed work items are moved to the Archive table in the PSWorkItem database. At some point, you may wish to clear out old archived tasks. There is no technical reason you would need to do this, but if you want to, use Remove-PSWorkItemArchive. You can remove archived items by ID, category, or name.
A PSWorkItem category.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
The path to the PSWorkItem SQLite database file. It should end in .db
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The archive work item ID.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
The path to the PSWorkItem SQLite database file. It should end in .db
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The name of the archive work item. Wildcards are supported.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
The path to the PSWorkItem SQLite database file. It should end in .db
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
A PSWorkItem category.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
The archive work item ID.
The name of the archive work item. Wildcards are supported.
The path to the PSWorkItem SQLite database file. It should end in .db
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

PS C:\> Remove-PSWorkItem -id 7 -Verbose VERBOSE: [12:37:40.2036443 BEGIN ] Remove-PSWorkItem: Starting VERBOSE: [12:37:40.2045322 BEGIN ] Remove-PSWorkItem: PSBoundParameters VERBOSE: Key Value --- ----- ID 7 Verbose True
VERBOSE: [12:37:40.2099707 BEGIN ] Remove-PSWorkItem: Opening a connection to C:\Users\artd\PSWorkItem.db VERBOSE: [12:37:40.2142745 PROCESS] Remove-PSWorkItem: Removing task 7 VERBOSE: Performing the operation "Remove-PSWorkItem" on target "1a2d1acc-738d-458f-8744-6a6e541a8bc5". VERBOSE: [12:37:40.2245915 END ] Remove-PSWorkItem: Closing database connection. VERBOSE: [12:37:40.2261433 END ] Remove-PSWorkItem: Ending

What if: Performing the operation "Remove-PSWorkItemArchive" on target "02290cca-5e59-45f7-a2d9-9f34bf51817e". maml:description.maml:para: Modify an existing PSWorkItem
When you need to update a task, use Set-PSWorkItem. You need to use the PSWorkItem ID to identify the item to be updated. You can then update the Name, Description, DueDate, Category, and Progress.

Specify an updated due date.
The updated name of the PSWorkItem.

The work item ID. This is how you identify the PSWorkItem you want to update.
The updated name of the PSWorkItem.

This command will update an existing PSWorkItem category. The category name is case-sensitive. Use caution when renaming a category that has active tasks using the old category name.
Specify a case-sensitive category name.

Write the updated category to the pipeline.
The path to the PSWorkItem SQLite database file. It should end in .db

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Set-PsworkItemCategory -Category work -Description "Uncategorized work activities" -PassThru
Category Description -------- ----------- Work Uncategorized work activities

maml:description.maml:para: Update the PSWorkItem database

Version 1.0.0 of the PSWorkItem module introduced a structural change to the database tables. If you are using a database created in an earlier version, you need to run this command before adding, changing, or completing work items. It is recommended that you backup you database file before running this command.
As an alternative, you could export your work items, delete the database file, initialize a new one, and re-import your work items.

During the upgrade, a new table column called ID is added to the Tasks and Archive database tables. In the Tasks table, the ID column for existing entries will be set to the row id, which should be the task number you are used to seeing. In the archive table, existing entries will get an ID value of 0, since it is impossible to know the original ID number. This database change corrects this problem. Going forward, the PSWorkItem ID will remain the same when you complete it and move the item to the Archive table.
The path to the PSWorkItem SQLite database file. It should end in .db
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
{{ Fill PassThru Description }}
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
{{ Fill PassThru Description }}
The path to the PSWorkItem SQLite database file. It should end in .db
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> New-PSWorkItem -Name "DOM1 backup" -DaysDue 3 -Category work WARNING: Cannot verify the tasks table column ID. Please run Update-PSWorkItemDatabase to update the table then try completing the command again. It is recommended that you backup your database before updating the table. dev:remarks.maml:para: You can't change the database until you run Update-PSWorkItemDatabase.

maml:description.maml:para: Update or create a preference file

Use this command to export your preferences for the PSWorkitem module to file. This file will be used when importing the module to set the database path and customized highlighting sequences for $PSWorkItemCategory. The file will be stored in $HOME.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Show the completed file.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Show the completed file.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Update-PSWorkItemPreferences

dev:remarks.maml:para: This assumes you've customized category settings or the database path.
